explanation: Not correct. Although 'msg' is only read (not written) in this function, it points to dynamically allocated memory that is freed with free(msg). Declaring it as 'const unsigned char *' would force an explicit cast when calling free (or require changing the allocation/freeing API), which would violate other MISRA rules about discarding qualifiers. In other words, it is not reasonably possible here to make the pointer const without breaking the ownership/freeing semantics or introducing casts. Therefore this code does not constitute a straightforward violation of MISRA C:2023 Rule 8.13.
